TITLE: Saudi Arabia presses top E.U. diplomats to lift sanctions on Syria after Assad’s fall
SUMMARY: European and Middle Eastern diplomats met in the Saudi capital, Riyadh, to discuss Syria’s future

TITLE: India kicks off a massive Hindu festival touted as the world's largest religious gathering

TITLE: A young gorilla rescued from an aircraft hold recovers at Istanbul zoo

SUMMARY: The Japanese Meteorological Agency said tsunami waves have already reached the country's southwestern coasts, with an estimated maximum height of 3.2 feet

SUMMARY: No foreign government has recognized the Taliban because of their restrictive stance on women, while the U.N. has said their policies amount to “gender apartheid

SUMMARY: Despite its low profile in Turkey, the LGBTQ community has emerged as one of the main targets of the government and its supporters in recent years

SUMMARY: Trump said he would most likely impose new sanctions, taxes and tariffs on Russia, whose economy he said was failing

SUMMARY: Officials warned the storm could be dangerous and told people to stay indoors

SUMMARY: South Korea said this month that about 300 of the more than 10,000 North Korean soldiers fighting with Russia against Ukraine had died and 2,700 others had been injured

SUMMARY: With many of his political opponents either jailed or exiled abroad, the 70-year-old  Alexander Lukashenko is back on the ballot, all but certain to add a seventh presidential term
